meaningMnemonic: Remember 地下, which is "below ground." Well, this is <kanji>ground</kanji> and <kanji>above</kanji> combined together, so I bet you can guess that this means <vocabulary>above ground</vocabulary>. But usually things above ground don't float (unless you're in space), so it's really <vocabulary>on the ground</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
